document.title: INDIANA ACADEMIC STANDARDS World Languages American Sign Language: Secondary (ASL) 2019

2D733C6C0D4D40F1884007DBC5E35CB5.description:
I can play drums, engage in sign play, and play games that reflect Deaf
culture.

61FD388F70A34A9EABED3D2DEEB4D5DB.description: I can participate in recreational activities that reflect the Deaf culture.

B48E93F08FA54567984D41EE18C6E69D.description: I can use various media in ASL for personal enjoyment.

35DF106F45FC44089D4E605223D0911D.description: I can develop awareness of rhythm, vibration, and lighting.

E1BB968764F54C8F814882078E93D19D.description: I can engage in art activities centered on Deaf culture.

513AA12C7A54403D85E666BD004D7015.description: I can help prepare and sample foods featuring handshapes.

C6497813BFDE47579907954D7E5CDF2B.description: I can watch ASL videos or cartoons for enjoyment.

779238DB8505495DA6C2CBDDE327C4F1.description:
I can play games or other social activities typically played by Deaf children
who are deaf.

92A262ACA7BE4398882D682F5744AAAD.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can use ASL both within and beyond the classroom to interact
and learn in the Deaf community and in the globalized world.

9ADF286FF38447EDB4208DD6B4F14F15.description:
Lifelong Learning - Learners show evidence of becoming lifelong learners by
using American Sign Language for personal enjoyment and enrichment.

7622408B464142F1B346E3BC76F366AC.description: I can invite Deaf people from the community to participate in Deaf culture-related school events.

03D0129490E448C1945658E60F6B6A5A.description: I can participate in special performances related to Deaf culture.

293362B7EA5A4092B4DF798CCA477687.description:
I can communicate simple messages in ASL to Deaf people in the community
and abroad concerning everyday matters and daily experiences.

CC622E8D5D9A4918A1F0512C5B47AFAF.description:
I can participate in conversations with native ASL users about everyday
matters and daily experiences.

09D48E2D51F6410498AA3C08F66C78E7.description: I can perform a skit or short frozen text in ASL at a school or community event.

1B750C14ADAF432F841AD0582FCEBC5E.description: I can interact with Deaf guest speakers on a variety of topics.

C9A296BF2ACC4227B0C516805A91DF0B.description: I can learn ASL vocabulary for community locations and personnel.

A1264458D51A4505985A2B02180984E1.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can use ASL both within and beyond the classroom to interact and
learn in the Deaf community.

E694C7068A1241149BECA449D9C2115F.description:
School and Global - Learners use American Sign Language within and beyond
the school setting.

1B34C777C00A49F8AFD8A9D034BF1534.description:
Communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in
multilingual communities at home and around the world.

158BD859EB4A48F18069D003442AF0DC.description:
I can recognize the interests and practices that they have in common with their
Deaf peers and peers in various other cultures.

BABCDD37452C4D2C8D2627984250F7CA.description: I can compare and contrast intangible products of different cultures

13F5941EA5F9444FB273D0CAACA285A0.description: I can compare and contrast tangible products and practices of various cultures.

B02FE2B92A8E49638622464613548B5A.description:
I can discuss that most languages use gestures, and that gestures and sign
languages differ among cultures.

3713FE559AB048D7AA0C086D6F1CA69F.description:
I can compare simple patterns of behavior and interaction in various cultural
settings.

28A98E91B4164D93A2479ED4704A955C.description: I can observe and compare toys and games mainly produced for Deaf children.

09B52722A69641FBA276FD2FECAA7C21.description:
I can identify the similarity between voice/mouth and hand/eye communication
and that different people communicate in different ways.

5D6CF80F4D27484D827023EE6A81288C.description: I can compare simple patterns of behavior in Deaf culture and other cultures.

0E29D7EC98B04584A86BF44263EC794C.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify basic differences and similarities between American
Deaf culture, American Culture, and other signed languages - countries’ cultures.

4A65F998FFBF4DE58FC10308748D9A6A.description:
Language Comparisons - Learners discuss the nature of language through
comparisons of American Sign Languages and other languages.

C4F609DA7D6D41A58F553C43234FCCE6.description:
I can discuss differences and similarities between the inflections of their own
language and the role of non-manual signals in ASL.

C3F235CFC6F34608AC95584868BFB4F6.description:
I can explain formal and informal forms of language and try out expressions of
politeness in ASL and in their own language.

823D1C9D09DE4F8D8FE1A8A0D1399E89.description:
I can explain an emerging awareness that word order in ASL and English are
often different.

035445C9D4A34B859822337519D84608.description:
I can experiment with forming age-and developmentally-appropriate facial
expressions and non-manual signals.

4C0863FE8A3840DFAA9341864044CC81.description:
I can identify age- and developmentally-appropriate understanding of
parameters including location and movement.

6DF2525610FB4564A829ECA9D56B80FB.description: I can use examples of personal and possessive pronouns in ASL.

315926C342C34E3EBB163685876C5CAE.description:
I can develop an understanding of the existence of noun-related classifiers in
ASL.

A1164C7D8F8E493CA770064DF42FF2F5.description: I can compare the alphabet and numbers in English and handshapes in ASL.

7AA77C18F181414CAB3DE4ED999488DC.description: Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify basic differences and similarities between ASL, English, and other signed languages (from other countries).

815CA124A5044213B34E4D44786EDEF2.description:
Cultural Comparisons – Learners discuss the nature of culture through
comparisons of American Deaf culture, American culture, and other signed languages (countries’
cultures).

4862630643B4453BB00908D359579557.description:
Develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with
cultural competence.

84303F6BA80D4CD7A97E2A4DDCD6AFED.description:
I can use age-appropriate sources intended for native ASL users to prepare
reports and presentations on topics of personal interest or those with which they have limited
previous experience.

B77BA70878C44D85B1E09DDB492D957F.description:
I can identify and discuss Deaf contributions to the development of world culture
in the sciences, arts, and society in general.

D57109AA1D2D4048B9E483B7232510AF.description:
I can view and talk about ASL folk tales, short stories, and poems that have
been developed for young people and passed down for generations.

8956630ED15E4EE48E4EAB4550454BE4.description:
I can show and tell about the illustrations in Deaf children’s books that show
views of people and places in the Deaf World.

4FDD36617D2249E6BA8EB6F585927218.description:
I can show and tell about Deaf-related pictures and souvenirs toenhance their
exploration of other topics.

440A8516C05F4C06AADE3FF3F2A16B53.description:
I can view and ask/answer questions about age and developmentally-appropriate
short stories, poems, and content-related materials.

0855B566E3EF4AB69ADDB13322CD4189.description: I can discuss core cultural values, particularly that being Deaf is a positive trait.

9D72715B3FBD4C50990140C10DD0EC09.description:
I can view and discuss folktales and stories in ASL that reflect cultural practices
and historical figures.

C07761C8810442CFB883F1DA23DD2D84.description: I can discuss the value in using the hands and eyes.

BE9CE45B519C447592E8845770A59C9C.description: I can explain how lighting may be used for different purposes.

8A2870E8E36E4FE8B5FFCC1C4AEFAEAE.description: I can use the aesthetic value of rhythm, timing, and vibration.

05775BF8EDAB42AD97350630DCA74D39.description: I can view and perform simple greetings and handshape rhymes in ASL.

01E4FF26AD1F4BFC875C3A34BA3A7D8D.description:
I can watch and retell age-appropriate folktales, short stories, and poetry
intended for young Deaf children that fosters a positive image of being Deaf.

AD7FE82B2BB94DFD9C94E9B0B27D821A.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can access and evaluate basic information and perspectives that are
available through ASL and its culture.

17D9EE4A452F49AE966A9E0AD670CD4B.description:
Making Connections - Learners acquire information and recognize the
distinctive viewpoints that are only available through American Sign Language and Deaf culture.

01507E58E4BE457E91B9C70FC59CFCD9.description:
I can look at a variety of sources (e.g., pictures, maps, and videos) related to
topics in other subject areas and identify items in ASL.

990A8B59029B4AABB5BF573CEC6C40FD.description:
I can talk about topics from school subjects in ASL including technology,
historical facts, mathematical problems, and scientific information.

8061AB610B1D4BBA98594143500AA0D6.description:
I can discuss significant contributions of Deaf people to history, the arts,
sciences, literature, and other fields.

97E75DD4F21D495287D7A8E04951FC47.description:
I can select and use common numbering systems used in science, mathematics,
and other fields.

9C73A26F456243CE95A060A77017542E.description: I can use spatial awareness to identify and outline shapes.

907860544FB14B68B454D66E2E3692F1.description: I can identify and state community locations, personnel, and transportation.

3B2406D47A13416F97D9C275DFFCC878.description: I can identify family members and family relationships.

09E25936BCEA4610B6C92BEA0699C3A6.description:
I can select and use ASL numbers when making observations about people and
things.

B9FA1B2CCFD64F009CBCF5CCAA4F4FD1.description:
I can select and use American Sign Language vocabulary to refer to items and
concepts learned in other subject areas.

E9B6FAC9EE7F4373B8260ED6D282AE04.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can access and evaluate basic information and perspectives that are
available in Deaf culture.

9712CAB66FDD4785B6B8AE86A278C834.description:
Acquiring Information and Diverse Perspectives - Learners reinforce and
further their knowledge of other disciplines through American Sign Language.

D246A2967E5246FE85DE2578B5B20CF5.description:
Connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in
order to use the language to function academic and career-related situations.

42639C184453444181E757BB4F435D9C.description:
I can explain how the major themes of hands, eyes, and signs, appear in selected
pieces created by Deaf artists.

2AA5D36030D94D228FE97747A55F4F48.description:
I can identify and explain basic age-appropriate literature in ASL videogames and
television programs, and learn games played by Deaf people.

455B90C98589440F8F06887D7130E2FE.description: I can identify and restate symbols that reflect the Deaf culture.

B768E2D463A64CA0A38AD82F48F1B3AD.description: I can recognize and explain fundamental themes of the Deaf culture.

780E4AA48D364AD291EC61CAC6A32C79.description:
I can identify and explain tangible products used or created by Deaf people in the
community.

3F7D100C20F54F98ADD9F72A87D7C0E6.description:
I can examine and restate elements of art works created by Deaf people including
hands, handshapes, and eyes.

35EACFEC793546ED99F50B620F604365.description:
I can view and retell children’s literature in ASL, videogames and television
programs, and learn children’s games.

46A6EFCC2483474C9545485EC93D0968.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - In my own and other cultures, I can identify products and practices to help me
understand perspectives in the Deaf culture and in the Deaf community.

3BAE3321BC3D402998557F62A74BE1AD.description:
Relating Cultural Practices and Products to Perspectives (Investigate)-
Learners provide an explanation of the relationship between the products and perspectives of American
Deaf culture.

A862D72B8FF448CEA50E184F287BDFD0.description:
I can discuss my participation in activities enjoyed by young Deaf people,
such as: games, sports, dance, drama, and celebrations.

891347DB2F004E60BF892EB3E4DBB607.description:
I can perform expected social behaviors when interacting with mixed groups
of Deaf and Hearing individuals at Deaf events.

18373D59581C455B8E731F12FFEE2367.description:
I can compare and contrast between informal and formal social customs and
practices of Deaf people.

40BDF4CAFA89465099B29115776EED58.description:
I can discuss various communication strategies used by Deaf people in
their daily lives.

70367D4DA0B4446088BC123E52BC2561.description: I can interact with Deaf people in age-appropriate cultural activities.

7C390E39333D42E7AAC74B0C3816BD51.description: I can use appropriate attention-getting techniques.

71898CC06C064132B6E42932DCD61F63.description: I can identify and explain social customs and practices of Deaf people.

CDD92DF4E0C6471F9C1F9AB8176D8389.description: I can discuss common daily activities of Deaf people.

EA06AD5DC15E40378D658344CEF1BD3E.description: I can identify simple culturally based behavior patterns of Deaf people.

0815B750D90746868684CC2267062EC0.description: I can participate in age-appropriate cultural activities.

B03FF8D788E1457389D7880AF3B3E02A.description:
I can observe and use age-appropriate ways of expressing greetings and
farewells.

6EDB3D5A5DE74432A5B1FF05497D0542.description: Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can interact at a survival level in some familiar everyday contexts.

C45757604F7D44059FAF6332688E349B.description:
Relating to Other Cultures by Interacting - Learners provide an explanation of
the relationship between the practices and perspectives of American Deaf culture.

34A416CE8452415385166F277ACEEC7A.description: Interact with cultural competence and understanding.

C8311DB1C3EC487E84497E020E9136EB.description:
Students create simple, brief recorded messages about people, things, and school
events.

2DFA35D9C5024B74B9E896C87C8FBC1F.description:
Students present skits, recite selected poems, tell anecdotes, and perform stories
in ASL for school events.

2F85ECE237D5420B80DCFA80517D1C31.description:
I can prepare illustrated stories in ASL about activities or events intheir
environment and present them to the class.

457137F755334D7AA1AD8DBAF34B263C.description:
I can practice leaving recorded messages that include appropriate greetings,
farewells, and age-appropriate content matter.

872B6CEBACC84F6682E020D27E7C0BC2.description:
I can restate and/or rephrase simple information from live or recorded
materials presented in class.

AF4B14DA06E641F4AD4590AD63F9BFAE.description:
I can retell using various rhymes, short anecdotes or poems commonly known
among their peers in the Deaf community using visual cues for assistance.

49B36376234D4E02AE6E61BB8BB27D24.description:
I can restate and/or rephrase simple information from live or recorded materials
presented in class.

DA332022425843869E7A835B2E65DC68.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can present information on both very familiar and everyday topics
using a variety of practiced or memorized vocabulary, and simple phrases in ASL.

4413B996BA2E4645894CBC02E55421A5.description:
Presentational: Students present information, concepts, and ideas to an
audience of viewers in American Sign Language.

E62AC01C2AF440FF9B0CA49ECB03E026.description: I can follow directions given in ASL related to daily classroom activities.

B538A4E22FA64AC2BFF0C57AB0DD5E4E.description:
I can view and describe recorded descriptions of people, animals, objects,
places, common activities, weather, and major events, and identify corresponding pictures or
illustrations.

9764256856B2437F84D4AF2975CA17D0.description:
I can interpret and retell brief recorded messages on familiar topics, such as
family, school, and holiday celebrations.

B834694B031047B697E8036006B03ADF.description:
I can explain the relationship between handshape and meaning in selections of
ASL literature, including ABC, handshape, and number stories.

0C511E0D536C4527B405B7DD6B19EF76.description:
I can identify and explain the main ideas and details of live or recorded
discussions concerning current Deaf culture events, and subjects studied in other classes.

16A6C5B9012A41A6A8E2797D62D188E0.description: I can interpret and retell presentations on age-appropriate topics.

766C2AEF3A364F6298F609BF96297CCE.description: I can respond to simple commands and requests.

2A362051711C46FCAA74D80FD07E4866.description:
I can identify people and objects in their natural surroundings using ASL in live
or electronic formats.

96F3229DEBFF46B9BD17B7E4CC73AFDB.description: I can develop and use visual and kinesthetic rhythm.

AECDE9C23A2245FD89FC98DCFBC8D629.description:
I can watch and retell age-appropriate television programs that feature ASL and
characters who are Deaf.

14C5EA98F7304515A0BACAB2B2C333B2.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify the general topic and basic information in both
familiar and everyday contexts by recognizing practiced or memorized vocabulary or simple phrases
signed in ASL.

3659F8AB65A64E79B8E58AEF2A35BEAF.description:
Interpretive: Learners comprehend and interpret live and recorded American
Sign Language on a variety of topics.

0AFA150A7EC646E18A4C5319CF4F884A.description:
I can discuss personal likes and dislikes on topics such as athletes, films, books,
food, and holidays.

DDC7739FC5A842A2866CBAA0253C70B2.description: I can tell a peer an opinion about family, school, and recreation.

F686C21588544251BA66763C6CAD4F8F.description:
I can give and follow simple instructions in ASL to complete a variety of
classroom and cultural tasks.

36D0268335A64E699359524879B46745.description:
I can express simple two-to-three phrases in ASL about the home, classroom,
and environment.

5B10FBDBE7C34E4C99551AACFF295F6C.description: I can describe their daily needs, wants, and preferences.

08FAC2D4EE6F49CFAAE6FDAB8EC18FBF.description: I can apply spatial referencing skills and basic pronominal awareness.

5044A9D066274221B316F2810C806089.description:
I can select and use basic non-manual signals and /or facial expressions that
correspond to emotions and feelings.

D9D6E3A8EB9D43E494DF9D42D6E0FD84.description:
I can distinguish handshapes by identifying similarities or differences between
signs.

F5829B3A9A1143D08A72654711FEA350.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can communicate in conversations in ASL on both very familiar and
everyday topics using a variety of practiced or memorized words, phrases, simple sentences, and
questions.

6BBCC2597B6444E5977758B16CF84E2D.description:
Interpersonal: Learners use American Sign Language to engage in conversation
provide information, express feelings and emotions, and exchange opinions.

308F9BE79A3A43C08896877EA019642D.description:
Communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a
variety of situations and for multiple purposes.
